page.getByRole(AriaRole.LINK, new Page.GetByRoleOptions().setName("Home"));
  • Use getByRole for buttons, links, headings, checkboxes, etc.
  • More stable than CSS/XPath since roles rarely change.
  • Filters elements by their accessible name (text or ARIA label).

Example of explicit role in HTML:

<div role="button" aria-label="Submit Form">Submit</div>

Rule of Thumb: Prefer getByRole if a semantic role exists; fallback to XPath/CSS otherwise.

docs.title: 6. By Placeholder
docs.text: page.getByPlaceholder("Enter email");

docs.title: 7. By Label
docs.text:
<label for="email">Email</label>
<input id="email" />

page.getByLabel("Email");

docs.title: 8. By Alt Text
docs.text:
<img src="logo.png" alt="Company Logo">

page.getByAltText("Company Logo");

docs.title: 9. By Title Attribute
docs.text:
<button title="Click to submit">Submit</button>

page.getByTitle("Click to submit");

docs.title: 10. By CSS Attribute Selector
docs.text:
page.locator("input[type='text']");
page.locator("button[type='submit']");
page.locator("a[href='/home']");

docs.title: 11. By XPath
docs.text:
page.locator("//button[text()='Submit']");
page.locator("//input[@id='email']");

docs.title: 🔹 Handling Multiple Matches
docs.text:
<ul>
  <li class="item">Apple</li>
  <li class="item">Banana</li>
  <li class="item">Cherry</li>
</ul>

Locator items = page.locator(".item");
int count = items.count();

items.nth(0);  // Apple
items.nth(1);  // Banana
items.nth(2);  // Cherry

for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
    System.out.println(items.nth(i).innerText());
}

Locator banana = page.locator(".item").filter(new Locator.FilterOptions().setHasText("Banana"));

page.locator(".item").first();
page.locator(".item").last();

docs.title: 🔹 Summary
docs.text:
• Use semantic locators (getByRole, getByLabel, getByPlaceholder) for stable and accessibility-compliant tests.
  • Use CSS/XPath only if necessary.
  • Manage multiple elements using .count(), .nth(), .first(), .last(), .filter().
  • ARIA roles ensure robust, readable, and accessible test selection.

docs.title: Playwright – Drag & Drop and Keyboard Interactions (Java)
Example HTML
docs.text:
<div id="source" draggable="true">Drag me</div>
<div id="target">Drop here</div>

docs.title: a) Simple Drag and Drop using dragTo()
docs.text:
Locator source = page.locator("#source");
Locator target = page.locator("#target");

source.dragTo(target);
  • Simulates dragging from source element to target element.
  • Handles mouse events automatically.
  • Auto-waits for elements to be visible.

docs.title: b) Drag and Drop Using Mouse Actions
docs.text:
page.mouse().move(100, 200);  // Move to source coordinates
page.mouse().down();           // Click and hold
page.mouse().move(300, 400);  // Move to target coordinates
page.mouse().up();             // Release
  • Useful if elements are custom draggable items not directly supported by dragTo().

docs.title: c) Iterating Multiple Draggable Items
docs.text:
Locator items = page.locator(".draggable");
int count = items.count();
for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
    items.nth(i).dragTo(page.locator("#target"));
}
  • Allows dragging multiple items to the target container.

docs.title: d) Tips
docs.text:
• Use dragTo() for standard HTML5 draggable elements.
  • Use mouse() actions for custom implementations.
  • Combine with assertions to verify drop success.

docs.title: a) Typing Text (fill and type)
docs.text:
page.locator("#searchBox").fill("Playwright");  // Instant fill
page.locator("#searchBox").type("Automation");  // Simulate typing character by character
  • fill() sets value instantly.
  • type() triggers keyboard events.

docs.title: b) Pressing Keys
docs.text:
page.locator("#searchBox").press("Enter");     // Press Enter key
page.locator("#searchBox").press("Tab");       // Move focus to next element
  • Equivalent to sendKeys(Keys.ENTER) in Selenium.
  • Triggers keypress events.

docs.title: c) Keyboard Shortcuts / Combination Keys
docs.text:
page.keyboard().press("Control+A");  // Select all text
page.keyboard().press("Control+C");  // Copy
page.keyboard().press("Control+V");  // Paste
  • Can simulate shortcuts for copy, paste, undo, etc.

docs.title: d) Using keyboard.type() for Raw Input
docs.text:
page.keyboard().type("Hello World");  // Types text anywhere the focus is active
  • Useful when no input locator is available but you need to send keys globally.

docs.title: e) Full Example Flow
docs.text:
// Focus search box
page.locator("#searchBox").click();

// Fill and submit
page.locator("#searchBox").fill("Playwright");
page.locator("#searchBox").press("Enter");

// Select all text and delete
page.keyboard().press("Control+A");
page.keyboard().press("Backspace");

docs.title: ✅ Tips
docs.text:
• Playwright auto-waits for elements to be visible before keyboard interactions.
  • Use .press() for single keys or shortcuts, .type() for simulating typing character by character.
  • Drag & Drop and Keyboard methods can be combined for complex flows (e.g., drag + keyboard shortcuts).

docs.title: a) Click
docs.text:
Locator button = page.locator("#submitBtn");
button.click();
  • Simulates a single left mouse click on the element.

docs.title: b) Double Click
docs.text:
Locator textBox = page.locator("#inputBox");
textBox.dblclick();
  • Selects text or activates default double-click behavior.

docs.title: c) Hover
docs.text:
Locator menu = page.locator("#menu");
menu.hover();
  • Moves mouse over the element (useful for dropdowns, tooltips).

docs.title: d) Move Mouse
docs.text:
page.mouse().move(200, 300);
  • Moves mouse pointer to specific screen coordinates.

docs.title: e) Mouse Down and Up
docs.text:
page.mouse().move(100, 200); // Move to element
page.mouse().down();         // Press and hold mouse button
page.mouse().up();           // Release mouse button
  • Useful for drag-and-drop or click-and-hold actions.

docs.title: f) Click at Coordinates
docs.text:
page.mouse().click(150, 250);
  • Clicks at absolute screen coordinates, bypassing locators.

docs.title: g) Right Click
docs.text:
Locator element = page.locator("#contextMenu");
element.click(new Locator.ClickOptions().setButton(MouseButton.RIGHT));
  • Opens context menus.

docs.title: a) Type Text
docs.text:
page.keyboard().type("Hello");
  • Types text wherever the focus is set.

docs.title: b) Press Enter
docs.text:
page.keyboard().press("Enter");
  • Simulates pressing Enter key.

docs.title: c) Key Down and Key Up
docs.text:
page.keyboard().down("Shift");   // Hold Shift
page.keyboard().up("Shift");     // Release Shift
  • Useful for combinations like Shift+Click.

docs.title: d) Sequential Typing
docs.text:
Locator field = page.locator("#username");
field.pressSequentially("Playwright");
  • Types text character by character into a field (human-like typing).

docs.title: 🌐 Playwright Java – Navigation Actions
docs.text: This document explains all navigation-related actions available in Java Playwright with examples.

docs.title: 1. page.navigate("https://example.com")
docs.text:
👉 Navigates the browser to the given URL. - Waits until the page is loaded (load event by default). - Supports additional options like timeout, waiting for specific load states, etc.

Example:

Page page = context.newPage();
page.navigate("https://example.com");

With options (wait until DOM content loaded):

page.navigate("https://example.com",
    new Page.NavigateOptions().setWaitUntil(LoadState.DOMCONTENTLOADED));

docs.title: 2. page.goBack()
docs.text:
👉 Simulates the browser back button. - Goes to the previous page in the history. - Returns a Response object if navigation is successful, or null if there’s no history.

Example:

page.navigate("https://example.com");
page.navigate("https://google.com");

// Go back to example.com
page.goBack();

docs.title: 3. page.goForward()
docs.text:
👉 Simulates the browser forward button. - Moves forward in the history if available. - Returns a Response object or null if no forward entry exists.

Example:

page.goBack();     // goes to example.com
page.goForward();  // goes to google.com again

docs.title: 4. page.reload()
docs.text:
👉 Reloads the current page. - Similar to pressing the refresh button. - By default waits for the load event, but you can customize wait states.

Example:

page.reload();

With options:

page.reload(new Page.ReloadOptions().setWaitUntil(LoadState.DOMCONTENTLOADED));

docs.title: 5. page.title()
docs.text:
👉 Gets the title of the current page (the <title> tag content). - Returns a String.

Example:

String title = page.title();
System.out.println("Page title is: " + title);

docs.title: 6. page.url()
docs.text:
👉 Returns the current page URL as a String.

Example:

System.out.println("Current URL: " + page.url());

docs.title: 7. page.content()
docs.text:
👉 Returns the full HTML content of the page as a String. - Useful for debugging, parsing, or verifying HTML.

Example:

String html = page.content();
System.out.println(html);

docs.title: 🔑 Quick Notes
docs.text:
• navigate, goBack, goForward, and reload return a Response object → you can check status codes, headers, etc.
  • title, url, and content return String values → handy for validations in tests.
  • All navigation methods can take optional parameters like timeout and waitUntil (load, domcontentloaded, networkidle).

docs.title: Playwright Components: Class vs Interface (Java)
docs.text: Component Type in Java Explanation Playwright Class (com.microsoft.playwright.Playwright) Entry point for creating browsers. You call Playwright.create() to get an instance. Browser Interface (com.microsoft.playwright.Browser) Represents a running browser (Chromium, Firefox, WebKit). You don’t instantiate it directly; Playwright returns it when you launch a browser. BrowserContext Interface (com.microsoft.playwright.BrowserContext) Represents an isolated session within a browser. Returned by browser.newContext(). Page Interface (com.microsoft.playwright.Page) Represents a tab or page inside a context. Returned by context.newPage().

docs.title: 1️⃣ Typing / Entering Text into Input Boxes
docs.text:
Selenium Equivalent:

driver.findElement(By.id("searchBox")).sendKeys("Playwright");

docs.title: a) Using fill()
docs.text:
page.locator("#searchBox").fill("Playwright");
  • What it does: Clears any existing text and sets the new value.
  • Auto-waiting: Waits until the element is visible and enabled.
  • Best for: Setting values directly in forms.

docs.title: b) Using type()
docs.text:
page.locator("#searchBox").type("Playwright");
  • What it does: Types character by character, simulating real user typing.
  • Difference from fill():
  • fill() instantly sets the value.
  • type() simulates typing and triggers keyboard events.
  • Best for: Autocomplete, search boxes, or typing behavior testing.

docs.title: c) Pressing Keys
docs.text:
page.locator("#searchBox").fill("Playwright");
page.locator("#searchBox").press("Enter");
  • Equivalent to: sendKeys(Keys.ENTER) in Selenium.
  • Use case: Submitting forms via keyboard.

docs.title: d) Example Full Search Box Flow
docs.text:
page.locator("#searchBox").fill("Playwright");  // Type text instantly
page.locator("#searchBox").press("Enter");      // Submit by Enter key

docs.title: Difference Between fill() and type()
docs.text: Feature fill() type() Action Sets value instantly Types character by character Auto-clear Yes, clears existing text No, appends to existing text unless cleared manually Speed Fast Slower, simulates typing Events triggered Minimal Triggers keypress, input events Best for Form filling Autocomplete, typing simulation, keyboard events

docs.title: 2️⃣ Clicking on Buttons
docs.text:
Selenium Equivalent:

driver.findElement(By.id("submitBtn")).click();

docs.title: a) Simple Click
docs.text:
page.locator("#submitBtn").click();
  • Waits automatically for the button to be visible and enabled.
  • No need for Thread.sleep() or explicit waits.

docs.title: b) Click by Text
docs.text:
page.getByText("Submit").click();
  • Finds element by visible text.
  • Useful if ID or class is not available.

docs.title: c) Click by Role (ARIA)
docs.text:
page.getByRole(AriaRole.BUTTON, new Page.GetByRoleOptions().setName("Submit")).click();
  • Uses accessibility info (semantic role).
  • Very stable; less likely to break if HTML changes.
  • Recommended for modern accessible web apps.

docs.title: Java Playwright – Screenshots & Videos Examples
docs.text: This guide explains how to handle Screenshots and Videos in Java Playwright with practical code examples.

docs.title: ✅ Full Page Screenshot
docs.text:
import com.microsoft.playwright.*;
import java.nio.file.Paths;

public class FullPageScreenshot {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try (Playwright playwright = Playwright.create()) {
            Browser browser = playwright.chromium().launch(new BrowserType.LaunchOptions().setHeadless(false));
            Page page = browser.newPage();

            page.navigate("https://example.com");

            // Capture full page screenshot
            page.screenshot(new Page.ScreenshotOptions()
                .setPath(Paths.get("C:\\Users\\Sandesh\\Desktop\\fullpage.png"))
                .setFullPage(true));

            System.out.println("✅ Full page screenshot captured");
        }
    }
}

docs.title: ✅ Element Screenshot
docs.text:
import com.microsoft.playwright.*;
import java.nio.file.Paths;

public class ElementScreenshot {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try (Playwright playwright = Playwright.create()) {
            Browser browser = playwright.chromium().launch(new BrowserType.LaunchOptions().setHeadless(false));
            Page page = browser.newPage();

            page.navigate("https://example.com");

            // Take screenshot of a specific element
            Locator heading = page.locator("h1");
            heading.screenshot(new Locator.ScreenshotOptions()
                .setPath(Paths.get("C:\\Users\\Sandesh\\Desktop\\element.png")));

            System.out.println("✅ Element screenshot captured");
        }
    }
}

docs.title: ✅ Screenshot After Assertion
docs.text:
import com.microsoft.playwright.*;
import java.nio.file.Paths;

public class ScreenshotWithAssertion {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try (Playwright playwright = Playwright.create()) {
            Browser browser = playwright.chromium().launch(new BrowserType.LaunchOptions().setHeadless(false));
            Page page = browser.newPage();

            page.navigate("https://example.com");

            // Assertion
            String title = page.title();
            assert title.contains("Example");

            // Capture screenshot after validation
            page.screenshot(new Page.ScreenshotOptions()
                .setPath(Paths.get("C:\\Users\\Sandesh\\Desktop\\assertion.png")));

            System.out.println("✅ Screenshot captured after assertion");
        }
    }
}

docs.title: ✅ Record Video for a Single Page
docs.text:
import com.microsoft.playwright.*;
import java.nio.file.Paths;

public class RecordVideoExample {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try (Playwright playwright = Playwright.create()) {
            Browser browser = playwright.chromium().launch(new BrowserType.LaunchOptions().setHeadless(false));

            // Enable video recording when creating context
            BrowserContext context = browser.newContext(new Browser.NewContextOptions()
                .setRecordVideoDir(Paths.get("C:\\Users\\Sandesh\\Desktop\\videos"))
                .setRecordVideoSize(1280, 720));

            Page page = context.newPage();
            page.navigate("https://example.com");
            page.click("a"); // some action

            // Close context to ensure video is saved
            context.close();

            System.out.println("✅ Video recorded and saved");
        }
    }
}

docs.title: ✅ Record Video for Each Test (Dynamic Naming)
docs.text:
import com.microsoft.playwright.*;
import java.nio.file.Paths;

public class RecordVideoDynamicName {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try (Playwright playwright = Playwright.create()) {
            Browser browser = playwright.chromium().launch();

            // Set folder where videos will be stored
            BrowserContext context = browser.newContext(new Browser.NewContextOptions()
                .setRecordVideoDir(Paths.get("C:\\Users\\Sandesh\\Desktop\\videos"))
                .setRecordVideoSize(1920, 1080));

            Page page = context.newPage();
            page.navigate("https://example.com");

            // Perform some actions
            page.click("a");

            // Retrieve video path after context closes
            context.close();

            for (Page p : context.pages()) {
                System.out.println("Video Path: " + p.video().path());
            }
        }
    }
}

docs.title: 📌 Key Notes
docs.text:
• Screenshots:
  • Use page.screenshot() for full page.
  • Use locator.screenshot() for specific elements.

  • Can be combined with assertions for debugging.

  • Videos:

  • Videos are recorded at the context level (not page level).
  • Use setRecordVideoDir() to specify folder for saving videos.
  • Close the context (context.close()) to ensure videos are written to disk.
  • Use p.video().path() to get the file path of the recorded video.

✅ This covers Full Page Screenshots, Element Screenshots, Assertion-based Screenshots, and Video Recording Scenarios in Java Playwright.
